skill.name: agile-ceremonies
skill.description: Agile ceremonies and sprint management specialist. Use when running standups, retrospectives, sprint planning, or tracking sprint progress.
skill.summary: Agile ceremonies and sprint management specialist. Use when running standups, retrospectives, sprint...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and template files. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, environment variable reading, or external command execution. This skill only provides structured templates for agile ceremonies.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to run consistent and productive agile ceremonies. This skill provides structured templates for daily standups, retrospectives, sprint planning, and team health checks to keep your iterations on track.
actual_capabilities: Structure daily standups with yesterday, today, blockers format
Facilitate sprint retrospectives with what went well and improvement areas
Create sprint progress tracking with burndown and metrics
Generate team health checks with energy and satisfaction scores
Document action items with owners and due dates
Produce weekly summaries with velocity and accomplishments
limitations: Does not integrate with project management tools like Jira or Trello
Does not automatically pull data from version control systems
Does not track sprint burndown charts over time
Does not send reminders or notifications to team members

use_cases.title: Run Effective Ceremonies
use_cases.description: Facilitate structured daily standups and retrospectives that keep your team aligned and improving.

use_cases.title: Track Sprint Progress
use_cases.description: Monitor sprint health with templates that highlight blockers, velocity trends, and team sentiment.

use_cases.title: Async Team Sync
use_cases.description: Keep distributed teams connected with async standup formats that work in Slack or Discord.

prompt_templates.title: Start Daily Standup
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a daily standup for our team. Include what each person completed yesterday, what they are working on today, and any blockers they are facing.

prompt_templates.title: Sprint Retro
prompt_templates.prompt: Facilitate our sprint retrospective. Cover what went well, what could improve, lessons learned, and create action items for next sprint.

prompt_templates.title: Plan Sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Help plan our next sprint. Include capacity planning, story selection, and definition of done criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Team Health Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a team health check assessment. Include energy levels, satisfaction scores, process improvements, and recognition for team members.

output_examples.input: Run a daily standup for our 5-person engineering team
output: | Alice | Completed user auth module | Start payment integration | None |

best_practices: Keep standups under 15 minutes by focusing on blockers and coordination needs
Follow up on previous retrospective action items before starting new discussions
Quantify progress with story points or completion percentages where possible
anti_patterns: Turning standups into status reports that should be handled in tickets
Skipping retrospectives when deadlines are tight
Vague blocker descriptions without specifying what help is needed

faq.question: Which agile frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Scrum, Kanban, and hybrid approaches. Templates adapt to your chosen cadence and ceremony format.

faq.question: What is the maximum team size supported?
faq.answer: Templates work for teams of any size. For standups over 15 people, use async formats to maintain efficiency.

faq.question: Can I customize the template placeholders?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates use standard {{PLACEHOLDER}} syntax. Modify them to match your team naming conventions and data fields.

faq.question: Is my team data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs entirely in your conversation context. No data is persisted externally.

faq.question: Why are my blockers not being resolved?
faq.answer: Ensure blockers specify exactly what help is needed and who can provide it. Vague blockers often get deprioritized unintentionally.

faq.question: How is this different from Jira or other tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides structure and prompts for running ceremonies. Jira tracks work items. Use both together for best results.
